channel.title: Google on Development Data Partnership
channel.description: Recent content in Google on Development Data Partnership

item.title: Macroeconomic Monitoring with Google Trends
item.description: Challenges such as a lack of timely high-frequency data make it difficult to monitor and evaluate changing economic situations. Google’s weekly search volume index (SVI) helped the International Monetary Fund provide more timely response and assessment of economic activity especially in Labor Markets and Tourism.

item.title: Economic Anxiety and COVID-19 in Southeast Asia
item.description: Challenge The COVID-19 pandemic has affected the global economy through lockdowns, disrupted supply chains and uncertain economic outlooks. Swift reaction by policy makers are required to prevent a deep recession.

item.title: Google, Apple, and Facebook: Understanding Mobility during Social Distancing with Private Sector Data
item.description: As countries around the world work to contain the spread and impact of COVID-19, the World Bank Group is moving quickly to provide fast, flexible responses to help developing countries strengthen their pandemic response and health care systems.
